++ Pure Virtual Function

AbstractFunction



+++ SUMMARY

VirtualFunction
  * with the expression “ = 0” appended to the function declaration. 
    * example: 
    * virtual void func() = 0;

* must be defined or have to be implemented in all derived classes.

* Defining a PureVirtualFunction in a class makes that class an AbstractClass by definition.


+++ DETAILS

* used to create an "interface class" in C++ 
* or 
* an AbstractClass .
